subtitle: A good mid-week meal that is easy to make - and a great combination of taste and texture.

method.text: Wash spinach and discard any tough stalks. Put into saucepan, cover and cook for about 5 min and spinach is wilted. Tip spinach into colander and drain well. Put cooked spinach into an ovenproof dish.
Poach haddock in milk for 10 min or until cooked. Reserve milk. Flake haddock, discarding skin and bones. Put haddock and prawns into dish, covering the spinach.

Melt butter and add flour to make a roux, cook gently for 2 - 3 min. Remove from heat and gradually blend in reserved milk and fresh double cream. Bring to boil, stirring continuously, to make thick smooth sauce. Stir in <sup>2</sup>/<sub>3</sub> of the grated cheese and season to taste. Pour over the fish.
Mix remaining cheese with breadcrumbs and sprinkle over the sauce. Bake for 20 min or until golden.

title: Haddock and prawn Florentine
